comments:
I know you have addressed variants of this problem but as root on a Linux box 
(Redhat Enterprise Linux 3.0 with JDK 1.5.0 and Eclipse 3.0.1) I am able to 
run Eclipse fine but as a user, I got the following error. I tried the -vmargs 
that helps with the ignore file locking, but that didn't help either. Would 
you guys know what might be wrong?

As per bug 44735 comment 37, the system property to disable file locking using
java.nio now is (and has been since the 3.0 release):

-Dosgi.locking=none

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44735 ***

traces.message: Exception in  org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator.s tart() of bundle org.eclipse.core.runtime.

causedBy.message: An error occurred while locking  file "/home/suhit/.eclipse/org.eclipse .platform_3.0.1/configuration/org.eclipse.core.runtime/.manager/.fileTableLock" : "Input/output error".  A probably reason is that the file system or Runtime Environment does not  support file locking. You m ay want to choose a different location, or disable file locking (using the  osgi.locking property), but  this can cause data corruption.
